WorkItem.Description:
Sorry if this has been brought up.  I tried searching and could find nothing.
 
I've upgraded my system from XP which Rawr ran very fast.  Upon switching to Windows 7 and Vista, rawr runs extremely slow, clicking item slots to bring up the item drop down list or even changing gems takes 30 seconds to 1 minute for the drop down list to appear.
 
I had the .net 3.5 pre-installed with windows 7, and just recently installed 4.0, I've even goofed around with the compatibility settings.  Still the same thing.  Kind of stumped as to why it's behaving like this.

Comments.Message: Well, something's affecting performance on your system; Rawr's performance should be near-identical between different Windows OSes.
That's what I thought too, so I tried it out on a Vista Machine, my laptop, and it behaves exactly the same.

I'm not sure what to tell you, it doesn't do this on my system (any of them) which use Vista, 7 and XP. There's something common to your environments that is causing this. What is on your Vista/7 systems that wasn't on your XP system?
Not sure, I only have wow, rawr, and firefox on both machines, other than that, they are clean installs.  I do have UAC on.  But I don't think that affects it other than saving info.
Where are you storing Rawr? It shouldn't be in Program Files or UAC will have a shit-fit.

I've just tried the previous build I was using - 2.3.6 - as well as the latest - 2.3.9 - (Win7 32bit) and it's giving comparable results.  Mage and Druid modules seem fine, but the DK one is extremely unresponsive.  Same results if I load freshly from the armory, or if I use an older, locally saved, profile.  It seems most noticeable when trying to use the item set comparison tool; clicking on an empty box to select a piece of gear takes at least 20 seconds, with Rawr as a whole being unresponsive during that time.
Rawr is in my root directory on my 2nd drive.  And I mostly use the DK model but it happens with all of them.  Both my OS's are 64-bit, that's the only major difference from when I was using XP.
.NET 4.0 hasn't RTM'd yet, you may be seeing perf or compatiblity problems as a result.
I was previously using 3.5 which came with Windows 7 with same results so I tried upgrading to 4.0.  Still the same.   I'll try rolling back to 3.5 again and see if it does anything.

Just to clarify, is the issue in performance ONLY on the DK model?

If it is, this is related to DK itself which we already have an open issue on.

It happens with every model, but the DK one is the most severe, other ones take about 3 - 5 seconds to open which is reasonable.  I suppose if it's a known thing this can be solved as that's the only model I use the most.
